subject: Re: [junit] Functional Testing with JUnit
msgSnippet: Actually, the book named The Pragmatic Programmer had an interesting section that was based on a previous article about driving a java GUI application
messageBody:
Actually, the book named 'The Pragmatic Programmer' had an interesting
section that was based on a previous article about driving a java GUI
application programmatically with unit tests.

I do not have the book right in front of me and thus I cannot quote the
author of the paper.

Craig

----- Original Message -----
From: <ghouston@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, June 04, 2001 9:43 AM
Subject: [junit] Functional Testing with JUnit


>
> Has anyone tried to drive Functional Tests with JUnit? How did you
> accomplish it? In particular, how could you drive a Swing GUI?
>
> By "Functional Tests", I mean tests that check the entire application
> as a black-box (or very near to black-box testing). It would launch
> the appliction, drive the GUI, and interpret the output of the system.
>
> My team has been very sucessful with Unit Testing, and we want to
> advance to running Functional Tests.
>
> - Greg
